title: Publish to NPM
description:
Publishing to npm involves preparing your package, logging in, and using the npm publish command.  Ensure your project has a valid package.json with required fields like name, version, description, and main. Use npm init to generate or update it. 

For public packages:
Create an account at npmjs.com.
Log in via CLI: npm login.
Publish with: npm publish.
For scoped packages (e.g., @username/package), use npm publish --access public on first publish. 
For private packages:
Requires a paid npm account.
Scoped packages are private by default.
Use npm publish (ensure 2FA or a granular access token is set up). 
Build and test:
Use prepublish or prepublishOnly scripts to build (e.g., npm run build) before publishing.
Set main to the built file (e.g., dist/index.js).
Use files in package.json to include only necessary files.
Test locally with npm link and npm install. 
Versioning:
Use semantic versioning (semver). 
Increment versions with:
npm version patch (1.0.0 → 1.0.1)
npm version minor (1.0.0 → 1.1.0)
npm version major (1.0.0 → 2.0.0) 
Automate with GitHub Actions:
Use workflows triggered on release to publish automatically. Include --provenance for supply chain security and --access public for public packages. 
Common issues:
Package name taken? Choose a unique name or scope. 
Version already exists? Increment the version. 
Publish denied? Ensure login and permissions are correct. 
Cannot read properties of undefined? Avoid npm access grant for new packages; use --access public instead. 
Always include a README.md, tests, and a CHANGELOG.md for maintainability.
